newsitem.title: GERMANY: Smaller cars behind profit drop -Ford Germany.
newsitem.headline: Smaller cars behind profit drop -Ford Germany.

text.p: Ford-Werke AG, the German unit of Ford Motor Co of the U.S, said on Monday that a trend to smaller cars and costs related to model changes were behind its first half 1996 profit drop.
The company said earlier in a statement its pre-tax profit in the January to June period slumped to 75 million marks from 400 million in the same period of 1995.

"The trend to smaller cars like the Fiesta means lower profitability as do start-up costs for new models in the autumn. A move to a shorter working week also added to costs," a spokesman told Reuters.
